segments.text: I have a real problem when I meet people .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What is it ? Maybe I can help .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I never know when to shake hands and when not to . Can you tell me something about it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you come from a country where they shake hands ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh yes . Men , women , and children shake hands all the time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s very simple . Men shake hands , women and children don ’ t .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But some women do shake hands . And now a lot of children have such good manners , they shake hands too .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , a good rule to follow is , for men you hold out your hand , for women and children , you wait and see what they do .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sure . Once you get the hang of it , it ’ s a piece of cake ! It ’ s nothing to worry about .
segments.speaker: S2
